description.narrative: Regional Dialogue for Future project - Fostering dialogue and social cohesion in and between Bosnia and Herzegovina (BIH), Montenegro and Serbia

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Number of people (teachers, youth, women, journalists and editors, sex- and gender-disaggregated) from participating 3 countries with increased knowledge and skills to bridge social divides. 2. Number of stakeholders who apply the acquired skills and knowledge in their follow-up work as a result of the programme support. 3. Total number of people (particularly youth) from participating countries who meaningfully engage in and contribute to identification of social cohesion barriers and priorities for the 3 countries. 4. Total number of dialogue platforms (gender balanced) bringing together political leaders and various stakeholders from the 4 participating countries in joint discussions on how to strengthen social cohesion in the region. 5. Total number of people (particularly youth) from participating countries who benefited directly from social cohesion actions identified through the dialogue platforms and implemented with the programme support. 6. % of the dialogue platforms’ recommendations for social cohesion in the region implemented with the joint programme’s support. 7. Number of effective advocacy channels (engaging equal numbers of both sexes) leveraging political and public support within participating countries for endorsement of social cohesion policy recommendations. 8. Number of social cohesion policy recommendations voiced through the regional dialogue platform that are endorsed by authorities and international community and contribute to their effective follow-up implementation.

comment.narrative: 1. (2018): Insufficient number of people (particularly teachers, youth and women) capacitated to support social cohesion in the region. 2. (2018): n/a. 3. (2016): 600 people in the national platform events in Bosnia and Herzegovina. 4. 2016): 0. 5. (2017): n/a. 6. (2017): n/a. 7. (2018): UN agencies in the participating countries have deployed successful advocacy efforts to promote social cohesion. 8. (2018): n/a.

1. (2021): At least 1900, as follows: (i) 800 adolescents (10 – 18 years old); (ii) 800 young people (18 – 30 years old) among whom 50% women; (iii) 200 teachers, among whom 50% women and (iv) 120 journalists and editors. 2. (2021): At least 50% of all stakeholders (in various target groups) apply the skills and knowledge acquired through the programme in their follow-up work. 3. (2021): At least 1,600 people (among whom at least 800 youth and women) from participating countries engage in and contribute to identification of regional social cohesion barriers and priorities. 4. (2021): At least 20 broad-based social cohesion dialogue platform events (gender balanced) bringing together political leaders and various stakeholders from the 4 participating countries. 5. (2021): At least 10,000 people (whereby 50% are female, and among whom at least 5,000 adolescents and youth) from participating countries directly benefit from social cohesion actions. 6. (2021): At least 20% of the dialogue platforms recommendations for social cohesion in the region implemented with the programme support. 7. (2021): At least 4 inter-connected and mutually-reinforcing advocacy channels help leverage political and public support for endorsement of social cohesion policy recommendations, including: (i) UN-led discussions with political leaders and policy-makers; (ii) regional dialogue platform; (iii) civil society/youth networks campaigns inspired through the programme; (iv) media. 8. (2021): At least 5 policy recommendations formally endorsed by authorities and the international community.

1. 0 2. 257 stakeholders who apply skills and knowledge acquired through the programme in their follow-up work, out of which 210 women. 3. 70 participants of the final regional dialogue platform and 100 youth participated in the Regional dialogue platform for youth 4. 1 Final regional dialogue platform and 1 Youth dialogue platform. 5. 4000 direct and indirect beneficiares of 19 cross border grants implemented. 6. 0 7. 0 8. 0

1. 650 adolescents and youth trained; 40 women trained. 2. n/a 3. 720 people from participating countries have engaged in dialogue events and contributed to identification of regional social cohesion barriers and priorities. 4: 11 dialogue events took place to identify priorities from the perspective of youth and other target groups in the programme. 5: n/a 6: n/a 7: n/a 8: n/a
